body.p: Which of the following is true of transmembrane proteins?

multiple_choice.choice: A. they help with cell identification
B. they are anchor points for other cells
C. they have hydrophobic regions that run through the entire phospholipid bilayer
D. they are important as transport proteins to move molecules in or out of the cell
A, C, and D are correct
both C and D are correct

feedback.p: Incorrect. Peripheral glycoproteins are the proteins that function for cellular identification.
Incorrect. They are within the membrane and cannot anchor.
Partially correct. This is true, they must have hydrophobic regions to be a part of the phospholipid bilayer, but what else?
Partially correct. This is true, they have a critical transport function, but what else?
Incorrect. Only two of these are correct.
Correct. Transmembrane proteins are found in the phospholpid bilayer and function to move molecules in or out of the cell.
